title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.14 - Compliance with aircraft weight limit required
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 78.14 - Compliance with aircraft weight limit required

State Regulations

Except in an emergency as defined in section
78.8
(h) of this

Part, the aircraft weight limitation for the airport is 60,000 pounds actual
gross weight. No aircraft exceeding this weight shall land upon, taxi on, park
at, or take off from the airport without previous written permission of the
airport operator. Operators of aircraft that have a certificated maximum
takeoff gross weight that exceeds 60,000 pounds and are operated below this
weight shall obtain prior written permission of the airport operator to utilize
the airport and shall provide the weight and balance calculations for the
flight to the airport operator, upon request. Public aircraft owned and
operated by the United States, the states and political subdivisions of the
states, aircraft owned and operated by the Armed Forces of the United States, and aircraft operated in support of military operations are
exempted. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
78.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
